intro: Lychnis kiwuensis subsp. erlangeriana, commonly known as the East African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in racemes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
